commit_message:
Improve consistency in API

Removed sections that are no longer required [1].
Updated header flags
Improved indentation and lists

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I7116f3ea89a4c38fad6a339bbfc6a3b8af2e0d60

commit_message:
Ensure most of ML2's core methods not in transaction

This adds a check to each of the core methods that other callers
(e.g. service plugins) may use to manipulate core resources. This
check prevents them from passing in a context that is already part
of an ongoing DB session because we do not want DB rollbacks to be
allowed after the ML2 plugin calls postcommit methods on drivers.

All of the core methods are protected except for create_port and
update_port. This was left out because of a few particularily deeply
nested calls to the port methods from the L3 code that will be
addressed in change I5aa099c2264636336ab0b76c0826b506e2dc44b6.

For more details, read the devref added by this patch.

Partial-Bug: #1540844
Change-Id: I9924600c57648f7eccaa5abb6979419d9547a2ff

subject: Fix repo constraints construction and package installation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 14:16:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a7421ea3f5fa72a2565ea4801162d07ef63b5006', 'message': 'Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in the constraints construction.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

This backport combines selective changes implemented in the
following reviews:

- Add logic to NOT build "proprietary" packages
  https://review.openstack.org/300505

- Updated py_pkgs to index requirement files
  https://review.openstack.org/345448

- Fix py_pkgs lookup to not include optional packages
  https://review.openstack.org/347834

- Update py_pkgs to itemise global pins
  https://review.openstack.org/347930

- Fix repo constraints construction and package installation
  https://review.openstack.org/350352

Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056

commit_message:
Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in the constraints construction.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

This backport combines selective changes implemented in the
following reviews:

- Add logic to NOT build "proprietary" packages
  https://review.openstack.org/300505

- Updated py_pkgs to index requirement files
  https://review.openstack.org/345448

- Fix py_pkgs lookup to not include optional packages
  https://review.openstack.org/347834

- Update py_pkgs to itemise global pins
  https://review.openstack.org/347930

- Fix repo constraints construction and package installation
  https://review.openstack.org/350352

- Correct global_pins depth
  https://review.openstack.org/350654

Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/05/350605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Install pip packages pip: name: "{{ item }}" state: present extra_args: "--constraint {{ repo_build_release_path }}/{{ repo_build_release_tag }}/requirements_constraints.txt {{ pip_install_options|default('') }}" register: install_packages until: install_packages|success retries: 5 delay: 5 with_items: repo_pip_packages tags: - repo-pip-packages

commit_message:
Force db_joined on action upgrade for nova-api db

On action managed upgrade db_joined was not called and the new required db,
nova-api, was not created when upgrading to mitaka.

Change-Id: Idde9655919dfb42b00f030d74c85ff09821e36ee
Closes-bug: 1611096
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller refs/changes/08/352608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'db_joined', self.neutron_api_relation_joined.assert_called_with( rid='relid1', remote_restart=True) self.db_joined.assert_called_with(relation_id='relid1')

Helper methods of Linux class were always synchronized and thus could

commit_message:
Linux.runCommand() and Linux.putFile() are now non-synchronized

Helper methods of Linux class were always synchronized and thus could
not be run concurrently even on different VMs/agents.

This has been addressed by applying a properly parametrized
io.murano.metadata.engine.Synchronize meta attribute to these methods,
so now they are synchronized only if executed for the same agent
arguments.

Change-Id: Ibf129316a092ba0231cd5445b688d6d5689c2256
Closes-bug: #1611332
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/56/352856/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: m: io.murano.metadata.engine Meta: - m:Synchronize: onArgs: agent Meta: - m:Synchronize: onArgs: agent

commit_message:
Pass missing variables to heat-params

Pass variables KUBE_API_PUBLIC_ADDRESS and KUBE_API_PRIVATE_ADDRESS.
The missing of these variables caused error on making certs.

Change-Id: I4b09bad955c5c59b0716cace54de4e21b81d55e1
Closes-Bug: #1611128

commit_message:
remove neutron 3rd party infrastructure

This was used solely by bigswitch, and everyone else has moved over to
devstack plugins. Cleaning this out makes the core logic much simpler.

Depends-On: I8fd2ec6e651f858d0ce109fc335189796c3264b8
(grenade removal)

Change-Id: I47769fc7faae22d263ffd923165abd48f0791a2c

commit_message:
Make Cinder access glance in round robin fashion

In the old rendition of this code, Cinder would attempt
one access to glance, fail, and then cinder would fail.  Now
it accesses all servers in round robin fashion.

Change-Id: I4759b0b586919b33f49b974312072820062f35c2
Closes-Bug: #1571128

commit_message:
Give PUBLIC_INTERFACE a default value

Also means to make it changeable.

Closes-Bug: #1611247
Change-Id: I0dc253b7ecf44a49d152f97f4858f7f2cf2ca6b2

added_lines: PUBLIC_INTERFACE=${PUBLIC_INTERFACE:-""}

commit_message:
Moving mariadb-disk.sh.j2 script to become common/common-disk.sh.j2

This PS makes mariadb script reusable by other services. It also moves it to
./service/common folder.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I717265ec3c5e407fd15d9db74ef6727000ac3e5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/46/352646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: template: services/common/common-disk.sh.j2

commit_message:
Delete conntrack entry with remote_ip on the other direction

Patch [1] is incomplete for deleting conntrack entries with
remote_ip set. This patch fixes the defect.
[1]: I44d6bd0c2465294b557fd01566b72e016d34bba3

Change-Id: I31c579dbe28e4e8e824912b695eaba9475cf0095
Closes-Bug: #1570171
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/318679/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dir = '-s' if rule.get('direction') == 'ingress' else '-d' ip_cmd.extend([dir, str(remote_ip)])

lib/neutron: Create initial networks regardless of neutron-l3

advanced workflow modeling and visualization.

This application will deploy GoCD server and number of GoCD agents

subject: Changes type format in object model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-07 22:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/ef337f2fa82470778a63d314a8864cd3a4ef3fc9', 'message': 'Changes type format in object model

Since introduction of the statics into MuranoPL
type object (ns:Class) becomes available to the
MuranoPL code as a data that can be assigned to
the property (argument, variable). But type object
is not JSON serializable. Thus if the object mode
contains type object (for example it could be the
dictionary returned by the dump() function) it
cannot be serialized any longer.

If we serialize type object into dictionary with
three attributes like we do for MuranoObject (type,
classVersion, package) this will not be compatible
with existing applications in case of dump()
outcome because for MuranoObjects those
three attributes were located right in the '?' section
rather than in a nested dictionary.

The solution is to encode all those three attributes into
a single string and teach serializer to produce such string
each time it sees type object in the object model.

This commit changes type string format into
"typeName/version@package"  where version and package
parts are optional. When deserializing object model loader
 still uses current "className" and "packageAttributes" as
 a defaults for missing parts of the new type string so
 backward compatibility is retained except for the case where
 the client put short type string into the type attribute of the
 "?" and don't expect it to change after the deployment.

Change-Id: Icd3b5e238ad09584b4b7fdfb74120820078715c6

commit_message:
Changes type format in object model

Since introduction of the statics into MuranoPL
type object (ns:Class) becomes available to the
MuranoPL code as a data that can be assigned to
the property (argument, variable). But type object
is not JSON serializable. Thus if the object model
contains type object (for example it could be the
dictionary returned by the dump() function) it
cannot be serialized any longer.

If we serialize type object into dictionary with
three attributes like we do for MuranoObject (type,
classVersion, package) this will not be compatible
with existing applications in case of dump()
outcome because for MuranoObjects those
three attributes were located right in the '?' section
rather than in a nested dictionary.

The solution is to encode all those three attributes into
a single string and teach serializer to produce such string
each time it sees type object in the object model.

This commit changes type string format into
"typeName/version@package"  where version and package
parts are optional. When deserializing object model loader
 still uses current "className" and "package" attributes as
 a defaults for missing parts of the new type string so
 backward compatibility is retained except for the case where
 the client put short type string into the type attribute of the
 "?" and don't expect it to change after the deployment.

Change-Id: Icd3b5e238ad09584b4b7fdfb74120820078715c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/48/352148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual('ContractExamples/0.0.0@tests', serialized[name]['sampleClass']['?']['id']) self.assertEqual('SampleClass1/0.0.0@tests', serialized[name]['sampleClass']['?']['type']) serialized[name]['sampleClass']['stringProperty'])

subject: network: introduce helper APIs for dealing with os-vif objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 14:29:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9b31dfbc15fd35d4c91807efa57982743841c5eb', 'message': 'WIP: network: add helper module for converting to os-vif object model

The virt drivers get given a nova.network.model.VIF python
object. This introduces a helper module which can be used
to convert this to a suitable os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase
subclass.

Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-19 18:12:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1302053e52db23d6702c42f7a9c569c07456726d', 'message': "WIP: os-vif: convert libvirt driver to use os-vif library

This refactors the libvirt vif.py module so that it uses the
os-vif library.

All the various get_config methods are turned into static
methods in the vif.py module. All the various plug/unplug
methods are put in subclasses of the os-vif Plugin class.
These plugins are all registered as stevedore entrypoints
with a 'compat_' prefix.

The existing nova.network.model.VIF python objects are
translated into subclasses of os_vif.objects.VIFBase,
referring to the compat plugin implementations registered
above.

This should provide a full compatibility with existing
deployments of Neutron which will always be providing the
VIF information in the legacy format. It avoids the need
for Nova to install any custom python packages beyond the
core os_vif library

When Neutron is later converted to use os_vif, it will
send a serialized os_vif.objects.VIFBase subclass over
the wire to Nova, refering to an external plugin. One
release after Neutron has shipped with full os_vif
support, the various 'compat_' plugins can be deleted
from Nova.

Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-20 10:06:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/70b8bf411bc475eb9056e8e14e621cf99b5c0538', 'message': "WIP: os-vif: convert libvirt driver to use os-vif library

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-30 12:47:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5d2731df304724907f82352e3e2eb169ba045b0a', 'message': "os-vif: convert libvirt driver to use os-vif library

This refactors the libvirt vif.py module so that it uses the
os-vif library.

All the various get_config methods are turned into static
methods in the vif.py module. All the various plug/unplug
methods are put in subclasses of the os-vif Plugin class.
These plugins are all registered as stevedore entrypoints
with a 'compat_' prefix.

The existing nova.network.model.VIF python objects are
translated into subclasses of os_vif.objects.VIFBase,
referring to the compat plugin implementations registered
above.

This should provide a full compatibility with existing
deployments of Neutron which will always be providing the
VIF information in the legacy format. It avoids the need
for Nova to install any custom python packages beyond the
core os_vif library

When Neutron is later converted to use os_vif, it will
send a serialized os_vif.objects.VIFBase subclass over
the wire to Nova, refering to an external plugin. One
release after Neutron has shipped with full os_vif
support, the various 'compat_' plugins can be deleted
from Nova.

os-vif is still set to use rootwrap, so this commit
is leaving the various rootwrap filters in place. When
os-vif change to privsep, we'll kill the rootwrap
filters in nova that are related to VIF plugins.

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-15 15:29:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a50d5bbcb95084ab422e42ae8fb12526cf04345b', 'message': "os-vif: convert libvirt driver to use os-vif library

This refactors the libvirt vif.py module so that it uses the
os-vif library for the linux bridge, ovs and ovs_hybrid
VIF types. This relies on the vif_plug_linux_bridge and
vif_plug_ovs plugins that are distributed as a standard
part of os-vif. Other vif types will be converted at a
later date, as & when os-vif plugins have been created
for them.

The integration currently works by the libvirt Nova driver
converting the existing nova.network.model.VIF object it
recieves into the appropriate os_vif.objects.VIFBase
subclass. This means that in the initial conversion,
Neutron does not need to know about os-vif.

When Neutron is later converted to use os_vif, it will
send a serialized os_vif.objects.VIFBase subclass over
the wire to Nova. One release cycle after this happens
we will be able to remove the conversion code for the
legacy VIF types from Nova.

When using os_vif each plugin gets its own section in
the nova.conf file named 'vif_plug_<plugin name>'
eg 'vif_plug_ovs'.

The plugins are required to use privsep for running
privileged task, but this commit doesn't delete any
rootwrap rules yet, as its difficult to untangle
which rules are still needed by nova-network or other
vif types

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556

"}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2016-06-15 10:43:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b51474803b50cd6b04636dba66f8b8b0520e6b2d', 'message': "os-vif: convert libvirt driver to use os-vif library

This refactors the libvirt vif.py module so that it uses the
os-vif library.

All the various get_config methods are turned into static
methods in the vif.py module. All the various plug/unplug
methods are put in subclasses of the os-vif Plugin class.
These plugins are all registered as stevedore entrypoints
with a 'compat_' prefix.

The existing nova.network.model.VIF python objects are
translated into subclasses of os_vif.objects.VIFBase,
referring to the compat plugin implementations registered
above.

This should provide a full compatibility with existing
deployments of Neutron which will always be providing the
VIF information in the legacy format. It avoids the need
for Nova to install any custom python packages beyond the
core os_vif library

When Neutron is later converted to use os_vif, it will
send a serialized os_vif.objects.VIFBase subclass over
the wire to Nova, refering to an external plugin. One
release after Neutron has shipped with full os_vif
support, the various 'compat_' plugins can be deleted
from Nova.

When using os_vif each plugin gets its own section in
the nova.conf file named 'vif_plug_<plugin name>'
eg 'vif_plug_ovs'.

The plugins are required to use privsep for running
privileged task, but this commit doesn't delete any
rootwrap rules yet, as its difficult to untangle
which rules are still needed by nova-network or other
vif types. privsep is configured per-plugin via a
nova.conf entry named 'vif_plug_<plugin namee>_privileged'
group.

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Depends-on: I3d26251206a57599385f2b9f3e0ef7d91daafe35
Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556

"}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:51:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6e0f2833912d4357a767bd1771ff0e300273fb59', 'message': "network: introduce helper APIs for dealing with os-vif objects

This introduces a os_vif_utils module to nova/network which
contains logic for converting between the existing Nova
python objects in the nova.network.model namespace, and
the os-vif objects under os_vif.objects

The conversion is currently only wired up for the Linux
Bridge and OVS VIF types, which are directly supported
by os-vif. Conversion of other types will follow as &
when os-vif plugins are created for them.

This object model conversion is only expected to exist
for a short-term. The intention is that Neutron will
later be converted so that it sends across a serialized
os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase object, instead of the port
binding dict. When this happens, Nova will be able to
directly deserialize the os-vif objects, skipping all
use of the nova.network.model objects.

As part of using os-vif, each registered plugins gets the
ability to read config parameters from nova.conf in a
private section named 'vif_plug_<plugin name>'. For
example the OpenVSwitch plugin will be in 'vif_plug_ovs'.

Plugins which make use of oslo.privsep for running some
privileged code will have a further private section in
nova.conf named 'vif_plug_<plugin namee>_privileged'
from which the privsep library will pull its configuration.
It is unlikely that operators will need to set any params
in this section, since the defaults should work optimally
for almost all scenarios.

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556

commit_message:
network: introduce helper APIs for dealing with os-vif objects

This introduces a os_vif_utils module to nova/network which
contains logic for converting between the existing Nova
python objects in the nova.network.model namespace, and
the os-vif objects under os_vif.objects

The conversion is currently only wired up for the Linux
Bridge and OVS VIF types, which are directly supported
by os-vif. Conversion of other types will follow as &
when os-vif plugins are created for them.

This object model conversion is only expected to exist
for a short-term. The intention is that Neutron will
later be converted so that it sends across a serialized
os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase object, instead of the port
binding dict. When this happens, Nova will be able to
directly deserialize the os-vif objects, skipping all
use of the nova.network.model objects.

As part of using os-vif, each registered plugin gets the
ability to read config parameters from nova.conf in a
private section named 'vif_plug_<plugin name>'. For
example the OpenVSwitch plugin will be in 'vif_plug_ovs'.

Plugins which make use of oslo.privsep for running some
privileged code will have a further private section in
nova.conf named 'vif_plug_<plugin namee>_privileged'
from which the privsep library will pull its configuration.
It is unlikely that operators will need to set any params
in this section, since the defaults should work optimally
for almost all scenarios.

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Id78858bc55ce4f3f0727cad644ef9c8f9f718556
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/269672/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. ''' This module contains code for converting from the original nova.network.model data structure, to the new os-vif based versioned object model os_vif.objects.* ''' from oslo_config import cfg from os_vif import objects from nova.network import model CONF = cfg.CONF def _get_vif_name(vif): if 'devname' in vif: return vif['devname'] return ("nic" + vif['id'])[:model.NIC_NAME_LEN] def _get_hybrid_bridge_name(vif): return ("qbr" + vif['id'])[:model.NIC_NAME_LEN] def _get_firewall_required(vif): if vif.is_neutron_filtering_enabled(): return False if CONF.firewall_driver != "nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver": return True return False def _convert_instance(instance): return objects.instance_info.InstanceInfo( uuid=instance.uuid, name=instance.name, project_id=instance.project_id) def _convert_route(route): """ :param route: nova.network.model.Route instance :returns: os_vif.objects.Route instance """ def _convert_routes(routes): """ :param routes: list of nova.network.model.Route instances :returns: os_vif.objects.RouteList instance """ return objects.RouteList( objects=[_convert_route(route) for route in routes]) def _convert_subnet(subnet): """ :param subnet: nova.network.model.Subnet instance :returns: os_vif.objects.Subnet instance """ return objects.Subnet( cidr=subnet.cidr, dns=subnet.dns, gateway=subnet.gateway, ips=subnet.ips, routes=_convert_routes(subnet.routes), version=subnet.version) def _convert_subnets(subnets): """ :param subnets: list of nova.network.model.Subnet instances :returns: os_vif.objects.SubnetList instance """ return objects.SubnetList( objects=[_convert_subnet(subnet) for subnet in subnets]) def _convert_network(network): """ :param network: nova.network.model.Network instance :returns: os_vif.objects.Network instance """ return objects.Network( id=network.id, bridge=network.bridge, label=network.label, subnets=_convert_subnets(network.subnets)) def _get_vif_instance(vif, instance, cls, **kwargs): return cls( id=vif.id, instance_info=_convert_instance(instance), address=vif.address, network=_convert_network(vif.network), **kwargs) # VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE = 'bridge' def _convert_vif_bridge(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFBridge, plugin="linux_bridge", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), bridge_name=vif["network"]["bridge"]) #VIF_TYPE_OVS = 'ovs' def _convert_vif_ovs(vif, instance): if _get_firewall_required(vif) or vif.is_hybrid_plug_enabled(): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFBridge, plugin="ovs_hybrid", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), bridge_name=_get_hybrid_bridge_name(vif)) else: profile=objects.vif.VIFPortProfileOVS( instance_id=vif.get('ovs_interfaceid') or vif['id']) return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFBridge, port_profile=profile, plugin="ovs", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), bridge_name=_get_hybrid_bridge_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_IVS = 'ivs' def _convert_vif_ivs(vif, instance): if _get_firewall_required(vif) or vif.is_hybrid_plug_enabled(): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFBridge, plugin="ivs_hybrid", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), bridge_name=_get_hybrid_bridge_name(vif)) else: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFGeneric, plugin="ivs", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_DVS = 'dvs' def _convert_vif_dvs(vif, instance): return #VIF_TYPE_IOVISOR = 'iovisor' def _convert_vif_iovisor(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFGeneric, plugin="iovisor", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_802_QBG = '802.1qbg' def _convert_vif_802_1qbg(vif, instance): params = vif["qbg_params"] profile = objects.vif.VIFPortProfile8021Qbg( manager_id=params['managerid'], type_id=params['typeid'], type_id_version=params['typeidversion'], instance_id=params['instanceid']) return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFDirect, plugin="vepa8021qbg", port_profile=profile, vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), dev_name=vif['network'].get_meta('interface'), mode=objects.fields.VIFDirectMode.VEPA) #VIF_TYPE_802_QBH = '802.1qbh' def _convert_vif_802_1qbh(vif, instance): profile = objects.vif.VIFPortProfile8021Qbh( profile_id=vif['details'][model.VIF_DETAILS_PROFILEID], ) if vif["vnic_type"] == network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFHostDevice, plugin="vepa8021qbh", port_profile=profile, dev_address=vif["profile"]["pci_slot"]) else: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFDirect, plugin="vpea8021qbh", port_profile=profile, vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), dev_name=pci_utils.get_ifname_by_pci_address( vif["profile"]["pci_slot"]), mode=objects.fields.VIFDirectMode.PASSTHROUGH) #VIF_TYPE_HW_VEB = 'hw_veb' def _convert_vif_hw_veb(vif, instance): if vif["vnic_type"] == network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFHostDevice, plugin="vepa8021qbh", dev_address=vif["profile"]["pci_slot"], vlan=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_VLAN])) else: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFDirect, plugin="vpea8021qbh", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), dev_name=pci_utils.get_ifname_by_pci_address( vif["profile"]["pci_slot"]), mode=objects.fields.VIFDirectMode.PASSTHROUGH) #VIF_TYPE_IB_HOSTDEV = 'ib_hostdev' def _convert_vif_ib_hostdev(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFHostDevice, plugin="ib_hostdev", dev_address=vif["profile"]["pci_slot"]) #VIF_TYPE_MIDONET = 'midonet' def _convert_vif_midonet(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFGeneric, plugin="midonet", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_VHOSTUSER = 'vhostuser' def _convert_vif_vhostuser(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFVHostUser, plugin="vhostuser", path=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_VHOSTUSER_SOCKET], mode=vif["details"].get( model.VIF_DETAILS_VHOSTUSER_MODE, objects.fields.VIFVHostUserMode.SERVER)) #VIF_TYPE_VROUTER = 'vrouter' def _convert_vif_vrouter(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFGeneric, plugin="vrouter", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_TAP = 'tap' def _convert_vif_tap(vif, instance): return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFGeneric, plugin="tap", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) #VIF_TYPE_MACVTAP = 'macvtap' def _convert_vif_macvtap(vif, instance): vlan = vif["details"].get(model.VIF_DETAILS_VLAN) if vlan: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFDirect, plugin="macvtap", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), dev_name=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_PHYS_INTERFACE] mode=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_MACVTAP_MODE] vlan=vlan, vlan_name=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_MACVTAP_SOURCE]) else: return _get_vif_instance( vif, instance, objects.vif.VIFDirect, plugin="macvtap", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif), dev_name=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_PHYS_INTERFACE] mode=vif["details"][model.VIF_DETAILS_MACVTAP_MODE]) def convert(vif, instance): """Convert a Nova VIF model to an OS-VIF object :param vif: a nova.network.model.VIF instance :returns: a os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase subclass """ func = "_convert_vif" + vif.type.replace(".", "_") return func(vif, instance)

commit_message:
Stack nodepool images targets in grafana

By stacking the targets in our panels, it will be easier to see the
precentage of nodes online.

Change-Id: I5f2c24362b39899b5689ed2adfacd361bcac4094
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/18/352618/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stack: true stack: true stack: true stack: true

commit_message:
upgrades job is renamed to updates

We are renaming current ovb upgrades job to updates because it doesn't
upgrade OpenStack version.

The patch depends on a project-config change:
Icb9b5f403346b747c38ac33f3879cdcbf89c97ac that were discussed and
approved on the ML.

Change-Id: Ia43c870b73162d9d081a47f9a961ef69f7332cf3
Depends-On: Icb9b5f403346b747c38ac33f3879cdcbf89c97ac

Verify the VPN service exists in the list of all VPN endpoint groups body = self.client.list_endpoint_groups() endpoint_groups = body['endpoint_groups'] self.assertIn(self.endpoint_group_local['id'], [v['id'] for v in endpoint_groups]) self.assertIn(self.endpoint_group_remote['id'], [v['id'] for v in endpoint_groups]) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_vpn_connection(self): ''' # commit_message:
Start a new directory to contain all SQLAlchemy models

As we have started oslo.versionedobjects implementation, there are
issues with cyclic imports due to same modules containing models as well
as database code (mixins).

To facilitate objects adoption, we need to split models out of database
code.

This patch just creates the initial directory to contain model modules
(pun!) and describes its intended structure in a README file.

https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg88910.html

Change-Id: Ie283fac6119411b15b965e94a5f694c74d2afc5a
Partial-Bug: #1597913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/351780/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This directory is designed to contain all SQLAlchemy models shipped with Neutron. The expected directory structure is flat, meaning there should be no subdirectories.

subject: Revert "Adds debug logging for policy file validation"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 06:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/policy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/804be5979569cc64dfef2ac2b6bc0c040d313aa0', 'message': 'Revert "Adds debug logging for policy file validation"

This reverts commit 5273d2c3a15c8807d80547bdb88707ba69defc05.

The commit in question more nearly doubles the .testrepository runs:

 -rw------- 1 stack stack 50M Aug  9 05:29 0
 -rw------- 1 stack stack 36M Aug  9 05:46 1

0 == keystone py27 with olso.policy 1.13.0
1 == keystone py27 with olso.policy 1.12.0

This can be seen in the gate[1][2].  Revert the debuging change until it can be
off by defult and used when needed.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/350197/2/check/gate-cross-keystone-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial/16c26fa/console.html#_2016-08-08_22_53_48_974404
[2] And it's preventing olso.policy 1.13.0 being used in upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I19a73e8935976cc98398665306cc104b66719951
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Adds debug logging for policy file validation"

This reverts commit 5273d2c3a15c8807d80547bdb88707ba69defc05.

The commit in question more nearly doubles the .testrepository runs:

 -rw------- 1 stack stack 50M Aug  9 05:29 0
 -rw------- 1 stack stack 36M Aug  9 05:46 1

0 == keystone py27 with olso.policy 1.13.0
1 == keystone py27 with olso.policy 1.12.0

This can be seen in the gate[1][2].  Revert the debuging change until it can be
off by defult and used when needed.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/350197/2/check/gate-cross-keystone-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial/16c26fa/console.html#_2016-08-08_22_53_48_974404
[2] And it's preventing olso.policy 1.13.0 being used in upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I19a73e8935976cc98398665306cc104b66719951

deleted_lines: return cls.from_dict(parsed_file, default_rule) rules = dict() for k, v in rules_dict.items(): LOG.debug('Processing policy: "%s": "%s"', k, v) rules[k] = _parser.parse_rule(v)

commit_message:
Remove outdated authtoken options

Outdated Keystone authtoken options have been deprecated for a while
(admin_*), removing them completely from manifests, providers and tests as
a first step of moving puppet-neutron to keystone::resource::authtoken usage

commit_message:
TEST DO NOT MERGE: checking agent report intervals

A recent patch to neutron changed agent RPC reporting for exponential
back off to timeout-single-shot. A few CI runs are showing a lot of dead
agents so I'm checking if widening the timeouts and health criteria.

Change-Id: Ieadf3763fc6702bdb8ca7258ba851928c13d38dc

commit_message:
Rename native-l3 rc file to nativeservices

Renaming native-l3 rc file to nativeservices since the job is now
also being used for OVN native dhcp, and will soon be used for
other native OVN services as well. This patch just creates a new
file with the new name, a future patch will delete the old file
once no jobs use it.

Change-Id: Ibf6a772d06f9b0a4e4f279f15fcfbca7c6c6a186
Partial-Bug: #1606942

export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=key,n-api,n-cpu,n-cond,n-sch,n-crt,n-cauth,n-obj,g-api,g-reg,c-sch,c-api,c-vol,horizon,rabbit,mysql,dstat,ovn-northd,ovn-controller,q-svc if [ -z "${RALLY_SCENARIO}" ] ; then # Only include tempest if this is not a rally job. export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=${OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES},tempest fi export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"OVN_L3_CREATE_PUBLIC_NETWORK=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"OVN_NATIVE_DHCP=True" # Begin list of exclusions. r="^(?!.*" # exclude the slow tag (part of the default for 'full') r="$r(?:.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])" # exclude things that aren't fully implemented yet in the OVN native L3 agent # NOTE: Re-enable floating ip tests once floating IPs are implemented # in OVN (bug 1514995). r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.floating_ips.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_floating_ips_admin_actions.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_floating_ips.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_minimum_basic.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_advanced_server_ops.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_basic_ops.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_v6.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_security_groups_basic_ops.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_shelve_instance.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_snapshot_pattern.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_stamp_pattern.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_volume_boot_pattern.*)" # exclude things that just aren't enabled with OVN r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_l3_agent_scheduler.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_quotas\.QuotasTest\.test_lbaas_quotas.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_lbaas.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_fwaas_extensions.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_metering_extensions.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.thirdparty\.boto\.test_s3.*)" # exclude dhcp agent tests r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.*)" # exclude this test case because this expects dhcp interface to be present r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_basic_ops\.TestNetworkBasicOps\.test_port_security_macspoofing_port)" # exclude this test because there are no agents used by OVN r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_agent_management.*)" # exclude some unrelated stuff to make networking-ovn targeted runs go faster r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.identity*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.image*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.volume*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.images*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.keypairs*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.certificates*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.flavors*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.test_quotas*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.test_versions*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.volumes*)" # End list of exclusions. r="$r)" # only run tempest.api/scenario/thirdparty tests (part of the default for 'full') r="$r(tempest\.(api|scenario|thirdparty)).*$" export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="$r"

commit_message:
Convert node groups to AutoScalingGroup

The OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup supports autoscaling and also rolling updates --
both of which we want.

Selecting the bootstrap Controller node is a bit tricky -- I'm not sure whether
the order in which AutoScalingGroup lists its nodes is stable. Is that going to
be a problem?

In addition, AutoScalingGroup doesn't support deleting a specific node for now.

Change-Id: I20022b77aa68276c83c1398935577d17f5b3b027

Can't do that with AutoScalingGroup and # pulling a Controller node out ain't that easy either (because of all the # allNodesConfig, etc. stuff. type: OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup properties: desired_capacity: {get_param: ComputeCount} # NOTE(shadower): we don't really want any limit here, but this is a # required property and update causes replacement. That seems limiting (what if you don't know the right values up # front, you'd have to redeploy everything). subject: Add undercloud without merge.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-04 12:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud-vm-nova-config.yaml', 'undercloud-vm-ironic-deploy.yaml', 'environment-undercloud-vm-ironic.yaml', 'undercloud-bm-nova-deploy.yaml', 'Makefile', 'undercloud-vm-ironic-config.yaml', 'undercloud-vm-nova-deploy.yaml', 'environment-undercloud-vm-nova.yaml', 'environment-undercloud-bm-nova.yaml', 'undercloud-bm-nova-config.yaml', 'undercloud.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/bfe810ce4daafb9bf10f46dbdf6a19225a4da902', 'message': "Add undercloud without merge.py

This adds a new template undercloud.yaml which provides equivalent functionality
to undercloud-sourc.yaml and undercloud-*-{config,deploy}.yaml but doesn't
require any preprocessing.

All the relevant config and deploy resources have been consolidated into the
template (we can split them up later if necessary, but this makes it easier to
see what's going on) and the actual differences (nova bm/nova vm/ironic vm) are
driven by the template parameters.

The added environment
files (environment-undercloud-{bm-nova,vm-nova,vm-ironic}.yaml) replace the
munging we were doing with make/merge.py previously.

The new Heat invocation should look like this:

    heat stack-create undercloud \
         -f undercloud.yaml \
         -e  environment-undercloud-vm-nova.yaml \
         -P ...

Couple of things to note:

1. devtest is using its own Heat environment for passing in parameters and
python-heatclient doesn't accept more than one environment right now.

There is a fix out there: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110984/

If you want to play with this in the meantime, just copy the relevant parameters
to $TRIPLEO_ROOT/undercloud-env.json manually or pass them directly using CLI.

2. Since this changes the way Heat is supposed to be called, the CI will
fail (and even if it didn't it would not test the right templates). We'll have
to figure out how to merge this properly (will require changes to
tripleo-incubator).

I'm not thoroughly pleased with the way it all worked out (especially having to
use a no-op config to effectively turn off a deployment), but I reckon we're
better off switching to a pure-Heat solution first and then showing our pain
points to Heat and getting them resolved.

And I think there may be a case to be made for another template/snippet
composition feature. Provider resources are too verbose for certain things and
`get_file` only works with plaintext.

Change-Id: Ic0077c72130211559f0bee807af619e86ba2ea24
Partial-Blueprint: tripleo-juno-remove-mergepy
"}]
commit_message:
Add undercloud without merge.py

This adds a new template undercloud.yaml which provides equivalent functionality
to undercloud-sourc.yaml and undercloud-*-{config,deploy}.yaml but doesn't
require any preprocessing.

All the relevant config and deploy resources have been consolidated into the
template (we can split them up later if necessary, but this makes it easier to
see what's going on) and the actual differences (nova bm/nova vm/ironic vm) are
driven by the template parameters.

The added environment
files (environment-undercloud-{bm-nova,vm-nova,vm-ironic}.yaml) replace the
munging we were doing with make/merge.py previously.

The new Heat invocation should look like this:

    heat stack-create undercloud \
         -f undercloud.yaml \
         -e  environment-undercloud-vm-nova.yaml \
         -P ...

Couple of things to note:

1. devtest is using its own Heat environment for passing in parameters and
python-heatclient doesn't accept more than one environment right now.

There is a fix out there: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110984/

If you want to play with this in the meantime, just copy the relevant parameters
to $TRIPLEO_ROOT/undercloud-env.json manually or pass them directly using CLI.

2. Since this changes the way Heat is supposed to be called, the CI will
fail (and even if it didn't it would not test the right templates). We'll have
to figure out how to merge this properly (will require changes to
tripleo-incubator).

I'm not thoroughly pleased with the way it all worked out (especially having to
use a no-op config to effectively turn off a deployment), but I reckon we're
better off switching to a pure-Heat solution first and then showing our pain
points to Heat and getting them resolved.

And I think there may be a case to be made for another template/snippet
composition feature. Provider resources are too verbose for certain things and
`get_file` only works with plaintext.

Change-Id: Ic0077c72130211559f0bee807af619e86ba2ea24

added_lines: # CUSTOMIZATION PARAMS: FOR vm, bm AND vm-ironic # default values will be specified in the respective envs NeutronPublicInterface: description: What interface to bridge onto br-ex for network nodes. type: string PowerManager: description: Bare metal power manager driver. type: string PxeDeployTimeout: description: Timeout for PXE deployment of baremetal nodes type: number IronicPassword: type: string description: Ironic password for keystone access hidden: true PowerSSHHost: description: SSH host to ssh to for power management operations. type: string PowerSSHPrivateKey: description: Private key for using to ssh to a virtual power host. type: string hidden: true PowerUserName: description: What username to ssh to the virtual power host with. type: string # PARAMETERS TO DRIVE THE SOFTWARE CONFIG/DEPLOYMENT RESOURCES UndercloudNovaConfig: description: Which Nova software config should we use type: string constraints: - allowed_values: - UndercloudVmNovaConfig - UndercloudBmNovaConfig - UndercloudVmIronicConfig UndercloudIronicConfig: description: Which Ironic software config should we use. Use NoOpConfig for NovaBaremetal type: string default: NoOpConfig constraints: - allowed_values: - IronicConfig - NoOpConfig # Nova-specific configuration & deployment. # This is run even when we're using Ironic. UndercloudVmNovaConfig: type: OS::Heat::StructuredConfig properties: config: nova: compute_hostname: undercloud compute_driver: baremetal.driver.BareMetalDriver db: mysql://nova:unset@localhost/nova commit_message:
Rework upgrade with plugin test

Since we are not testing detach-db plugin its time to switch to example plugin
- Move plugin test to separate file
- Replace detach-db plugin with example_v3 plugin
- Download the plugin by URL passed via EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL env var

Change-Id: I99217686be856acd8e69e93e5dd3ae40cbb1f15b
Closes-bug:1603415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/03/352403/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true, assert_not_equal, assert_is_not_none from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.tests_upgrade.test_data_driven_upgrade_base import \ DataDrivenUpgradeBase @test class UpgradePlugin(DataDrivenUpgradeBase): def __init__(self): super(self.__class__, self).__init__() self.source_snapshot_name = "upgrade_plugin_backup" self.snapshot_name = "upgrade_plugin_restore" self.backup_name = "backup_plugin.tar.gz" self.repos_backup_name = "repos_backup_plugin.tar.gz" @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_backup'], depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_release]) @log_snapshot_after_test def upgrade_plugin_backup(self): """Prepare fuel+example plugin with cluster Using: HA, ceph for all Scenario: 1. Install fuel_plugin_example_v3 plugin on master node 2. Create cluster with NeutronTUN network provider 3. Enable plugin for created cluster 4. Add 1 node with controller role 5. Add 1 node with separate-database role 6. Add 3 node with compute+ceph roles 7. Verify networks 8. Deploy cluster 9. Install fuel-octane package 10. Create backup file using 'octane fuel-backup' 11. Download the backup to the host Duration: TODO Snapshot: upgrade_plugin_backup """ assert_is_not_none(settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL, "EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL is not defined!") example_plugin_remote_name = os.path.join( "/var", os.path.basename(settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL)) self.check_run(self.source_snapshot_name) self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready", skip_timesync=True) # using curl to predict file name and avoid '*.rpm'-like patterns admin_remote = self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote() admin_remote.check_call( "curl -s {url} > {location}".format( url=settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL, location=example_plugin_remote_name)) admin_remote.check_call( "fuel plugins --install {location}".format( location=example_plugin_remote_name)) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) self.show_step(4) self.show_step(5) self.show_step(6) self.show_step(7) cluster_settings = { 'net_provider': settings.NEUTRON, 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['tun'], 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True, 'ephemeral_ceph': True, } cluster_settings.update(self.cluster_creds) self.deploy_cluster({ 'name': self.upgrade_plugin_backup.__name__, 'settings': cluster_settings, 'plugin': {'name': 'fuel_plugin_example_v3', 'data': {'metadata/enabled': True}}, 'nodes': {'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['fuel_plugin_example_v3'], 'slave-03': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'ceph-osd']} }) self.show_step(9) self.show_step(10) self.show_step(11) self.do_backup(self.backup_path, self.local_path, self.repos_backup_path, self.repos_local_path) self.env.make_snapshot(self.source_snapshot_name, is_make=True) @log_snapshot_after_test @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_tests', 'upgrade_plugin_restore']) def upgrade_plugin_restore(self): """Reinstall Fuel and restore data with cluster with example plugin Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_plugin_backup" snapshot 2. Reinstall Fuel master using iso given in ISO_PATH 3. Install fuel-octane package 4. Upload the backup back to reinstalled Fuel maser node 5. Restore master node using 'octane fuel-restore' 6. Ensure that plugin were restored 7. Verify networks for restored cluster 8. Run OSTF for restored cluster Snapshot: upgrade_plugin_restore """ self.check_run(self.snapshot_name) assert_true(os.path.exists(self.repos_local_path)) assert_true(os.path.exists(self.local_path)) intermediate_snapshot = 'plugin_before_restore' if not self.env.d_env.has_snapshot(intermediate_snapshot): self.show_step(1, initialize=True) assert_true( self.env.revert_snapshot(self.source_snapshot_name), "The test can not use given environment - snapshot " "{!r} does not exists".format(self.source_snapshot_name)) self.show_step(2) self.reinstall_master_node() self.env.make_snapshot(intermediate_snapshot) else: self.env.d_env.revert(intermediate_snapshot) self.env.resume_environment() self.show_step(3) self.show_step(4) self.show_step(5) self.do_restore(self.backup_path, self.local_path, self.repos_backup_path, self.repos_local_path) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.show_step(6) attr = self.fuel_web.client.get_cluster_attributes(cluster_id) assert_true('fuel_plugin_example_v3' in attr['editable'], "Can't find plugin data in cluster attributes!") admin_remote = self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote() stdout = admin_remote.check_call( "find /var/www/nailgun/plugins/ " "-name fuel_plugin_example_v3*")['stdout'] assert_not_equal(len(stdout), 0, "Can not find plugin's directory") plugin_dir = stdout[0].strip() assert_true( admin_remote.exists(os.path.join(plugin_dir, "metadata.yaml")), "Plugin's files does not found!") self.show_step(7) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(8) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot(self.snapshot_name, is_make=True) self.cleanup() @log_snapshot_after_test @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_tests', 'upgrade_plugin_scale'], depends_on_groups=['upgrade_plugin_restore']) def upgrade_plugin_scale(self): """Add 1 node with plugin custom role to existing cluster Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_plugin_backup" snapshot. 2. Add 1 fuel_plugin_example_v3 node 3. Verify networks 4. Deploy cluster 5. Run OSTF Duration: 60m """ self.show_step(1, initialize=True) self.env.revert_snapshot(self.snapshot_name) self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() slave_name = "slave-0{}".format( len(self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes()) + 1) self.env.bootstrap_nodes([self.env.d_env.get_node(name=slave_name)]) self.fuel_web.update_nodes(cluster_id, {slave_name: ['fuel_plugin_example_v3']}) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id)

subject: Fix manager->get_auth_provider interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 04:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9d7bac448af4e4073535b708e0a7496ed20b6e68', 'message': 'Fix manager->get_auth_provider interface

Tempest is defining stable interface of service clients
handling in lib but need to maintain the old interface
tempest.manager.get_auth_provider() as it is used by many
plugins and provide them a grace period to move to
stable interface.

This interface got broken while doing service clients work.
This patch fixing the same and fix gate for plugin using

Change-Id: I5733f20f5fba3c1aa1318405f5af976513eebf14
'}]
commit_message:
Fix manager->get_auth_provider interface

Tempest is defining stable interface of service clients
handling in lib but need to maintain the old interface
tempest.manager.get_auth_provider() as it is used by many
plugins and provide them a grace period to move to
stable interface.

This interface got broken while doing service clients work.
This patch fixing the same and fix gate for plugin using
this unstable interface.

Change-Id: I5733f20f5fba3c1aa1318405f5af976513eebf14

commit_message:
Disable mistral services by default.

Optional services should be disabled by default in the overcloud nodes.
This submission makes mistral disabled by default and allows to enable
it base on an environment file.

Depends-On: I942d419be951651e305d01460f394870c30a9878

Change-Id: I0dd245b75142834f71f3bd591b43c3f69d63217b

commit_message:
Rework upgrade with plugin test

Since we are not testing detach-db plugin its time to switch to example plugin
- Move plugin test to separate file
- Replace detach-db plugin with example_v3 plugin
- Download the plugin by URL passed via EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL env var

Change-Id: I99217686be856acd8e69e93e5dd3ae40cbb1f15b
Closes-bug:1603415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/08/352508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true, assert_not_equal, assert_is_not_none from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.tests_upgrade.test_data_driven_upgrade_base import \ DataDrivenUpgradeBase @test class UpgradePlugin(DataDrivenUpgradeBase): def __init__(self): super(self.__class__, self).__init__() self.source_snapshot_name = "upgrade_plugin_backup" self.snapshot_name = "upgrade_plugin_restore" self.backup_name = "backup_plugin.tar.gz" self.repos_backup_name = "repos_backup_plugin.tar.gz" @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_backup'], depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_release]) @log_snapshot_after_test def upgrade_plugin_backup(self): """Prepare fuel+example plugin with cluster Using: HA, ceph for all Scenario: 1. Install fuel_plugin_example_v3 plugin on master node 2. Create cluster with NeutronTUN network provider 3. Enable plugin for created cluster 4. Add 1 node with controller role 5. Add 1 node with separate-database role 6. Add 3 node with compute+ceph roles 7. Verify networks 8. Deploy cluster 9. Install fuel-octane package 10. Create backup file using 'octane fuel-backup' 11. Download the backup to the host Duration: TODO Snapshot: upgrade_plugin_backup """ assert_is_not_none(settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL, "EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL is not defined!") example_plugin_remote_name = os.path.join( "/var", os.path.basename(settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL)) self.check_run(self.source_snapshot_name) self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready", skip_timesync=True) # using curl to predict file name and avoid '*.rpm'-like patterns admin_remote = self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote() admin_remote.check_call( "curl -s {url} > {location}".format( url=settings.EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL, location=example_plugin_remote_name)) admin_remote.check_call( "fuel plugins --install {location}".format( location=example_plugin_remote_name)) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) self.show_step(4) self.show_step(5) self.show_step(6) self.show_step(7) cluster_settings = { 'net_provider': settings.NEUTRON, 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['tun'], 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True, 'ephemeral_ceph': True, } cluster_settings.update(self.cluster_creds) self.deploy_cluster({ 'name': self.upgrade_plugin_backup.__name__, 'settings': cluster_settings, 'plugin': {'name': 'fuel_plugin_example_v3', 'data': {'metadata/enabled': True}}, 'nodes': {'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['fuel_plugin_example_v3'], 'slave-03': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'ceph-osd']} }) self.show_step(9) self.show_step(10) self.show_step(11) self.do_backup(self.backup_path, self.local_path, self.repos_backup_path, self.repos_local_path) self.env.make_snapshot(self.source_snapshot_name, is_make=True) @log_snapshot_after_test @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_tests', 'upgrade_plugin_restore']) def upgrade_plugin_restore(self): """Reinstall Fuel and restore data with cluster with example plugin Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_plugin_backup" snapshot 2. Reinstall Fuel master using iso given in ISO_PATH 3. Install fuel-octane package 4. Upload the backup back to reinstalled Fuel maser node 5. Restore master node using 'octane fuel-restore' 6. Ensure that plugin were restored 7. Verify networks for restored cluster 8. Run OSTF for restored cluster Snapshot: upgrade_plugin_restore """ self.check_run(self.snapshot_name) assert_true(os.path.exists(self.repos_local_path)) assert_true(os.path.exists(self.local_path)) intermediate_snapshot = 'plugin_before_restore' if not self.env.d_env.has_snapshot(intermediate_snapshot): self.show_step(1, initialize=True) assert_true( self.env.revert_snapshot(self.source_snapshot_name), "The test can not use given environment - snapshot " "{!r} does not exists".format(self.source_snapshot_name)) self.show_step(2) self.reinstall_master_node() self.env.make_snapshot(intermediate_snapshot) else: self.env.d_env.revert(intermediate_snapshot) self.env.resume_environment() self.show_step(3) self.show_step(4) self.show_step(5) self.do_restore(self.backup_path, self.local_path, self.repos_backup_path, self.repos_local_path) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.show_step(6) attr = self.fuel_web.client.get_cluster_attributes(cluster_id) assert_true('fuel_plugin_example_v3' in attr['editable'], "Can't find plugin data in cluster attributes!") admin_remote = self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote() stdout = admin_remote.check_call( "find /var/www/nailgun/plugins/ " "-name fuel_plugin_example_v3*")['stdout'] assert_not_equal(len(stdout), 0, "Can not find plugin's directory") plugin_dir = stdout[0].strip() assert_true( admin_remote.exists(os.path.join(plugin_dir, "metadata.yaml")), "Plugin's files does not found!") self.show_step(7) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(8) # Live migration test could fail # https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1471172 # https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1604749 self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id, should_fail=1) self.env.make_snapshot(self.snapshot_name, is_make=True) self.cleanup() @log_snapshot_after_test @test(groups=['upgrade_plugin_tests', 'upgrade_plugin_scale'], depends_on_groups=['upgrade_plugin_restore']) def upgrade_plugin_scale(self): """Add 1 node with plugin custom role to existing cluster Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_plugin_backup" snapshot. 2. Add 1 fuel_plugin_example_v3 node 3. Verify networks 4. Deploy cluster 5. Run OSTF Duration: 60m """ self.show_step(1, initialize=True) self.env.revert_snapshot(self.snapshot_name) self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() slave_name = "slave-0{}".format( len(self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes()) + 1) self.env.bootstrap_nodes([self.env.d_env.get_node(name=slave_name)]) self.fuel_web.update_nodes(cluster_id, {slave_name: ['fuel_plugin_example_v3']}) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id)

commit_message:
Fix fuel xenial/trusty jobs

Fuel repos had in the past their own non-standard versioning scheme.
Change the branch conditions so that trusty jobs run on older branches
and xenial jobs on newer branches.
This has been done after review of which branches a certain repository
has.

Change-Id: I7ec6c734b1d4b3ffec6a27bc7b35f874fd65c7a4

commit_message:
Remove backward compatibility with pre-grizzly releases

Method get_instance_path libvirt/utils.py contained code that
keeps compatibility with pre-grizzly releases, where instance-path
was instance.name. This patch removes extra param from that method,
and code, that was used for pre-grizzly.

Change-Id: I50f3003f82f50a4b8d61b2c558093ec849ba86e1

subject: Remove duplicate jobs due to xenial move
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 04:45:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a3e71655254bbf02990373056b8390d2d3116d73', 'message': 'Remove duplicate jobs due to xenial move

We have introduced recently duplicated jobs for the xenial move with the
intend to run them only on Xenial for master and newer branches. But
existing branch conditions let us run some trusty or xenial jobs on the
wrong branches.

For example, reviewing https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352597/ you see
several ubuntu-trusty jobs on a master change.

Thus, we run far more jobs than we should. Remove the extra jobs and fix
conditions for them so that xenial and trusty jobs are run correctly.

Note that the fuel jobs are excluded in this change, they need further
review since they do not follow our version scheme.

Change-Id: I0a39c3cc625ea8b628ef359f6df6b2f173192538
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 04:52:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/8daffec0f2b0fc3c357f99cd4beb3a529600c843', 'message': 'Remove duplicate jobs due to xenial move

We have introduced recently duplicated jobs for the xenial move with the
intend to run them only on Xenial for master and newer branches. But

commit_message:
Remove duplicate jobs due to xenial move

We have introduced recently duplicated jobs for the xenial move with the
intend to run them only on Xenial for master and newer branches. But
existing branch conditions let us run some trusty or xenial jobs on the
wrong branches.

For example, reviewing https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352597/ you see
several ubuntu-trusty jobs on a master change.

Thus, we run far more jobs than we should. Remove the extra jobs and fix
conditions for them so that xenial and trusty jobs are run correctly.

Note that the fuel jobs are excluded in this change, they need further
review since they do not follow our version scheme.

Remove also now unused jobs from jenkins/jobs/projects.

Change-Id: I0a39c3cc625ea8b628ef359f6df6b2f173192538

commit_message:
Remove duplicate devstack docs jobs

Right now we have both trusty and xenial docs jobs running on each
change for devstack.

zuul/layout.yaml contains:
  - name: ^(gate-)?devstack-docs
    branch: ^master

Therefore the devstack-docs job is run only on master - remove the
trusty one as it's wrong to run it on master together with the xenial
one.

Change-Id: Idbdd643796c7955b84e492aebb610b56fb5e119f

commit_message:
Remove outdated Neutron auth options

Currently Keystone auth plugins should be used to perform authorization.
admin_* parameters as well as identity_uri are deprecated and not needed

Change-Id: I3018932a106df562e94067e037b3bc862be97b51

commit_message:
Add RefStackClient unittest runner

* *-unittest tox-test *require* pre-installed and configured
  murano-test-runner

* apps_uploader.sh - simple script which allow
  to pack and upload packages to murano
  (usefully for automate uploading from tox)

* More information about test-runner[1]

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/murano/draft/appdev-guide/app_unit_tests.html

Needed-By: I2e354d3ad2e24b29a374e629c51c297e8938bd64

Change-Id: If285fd40fa0a1dcb9ffdf01ad646471e77631260

commit_message:
Remove static hieradata

Static hieradata moved to composable services, we don't need the files
anymore. It also cleanup how we construct Hieradata configuration by
removing unused hiera files.

Change-Id: I19f85b6c1b734473cf908ddaca29ad966f9f5405

commit_message:
Improve readability of the overcloud failure output

* remove -n from echo to get line breaks
* remove unnecessary echo that eats the line breaks
* add sed line to strip colors from the puppet output

Change-Id: Iccfe9eedb8dd9af00a69c58434102e15a0e3e781
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/55/351155/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: do echo "heat deployment-show out put for deployment: $failed" >> failed_deployments.log echo "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log # the sed part removes color codes from the text heat deployment-show $failed | jq -r .output_values.deploy_stderr | sed -r "s:\x1B\[[0-9;]*[mK]::g" >> failed_deployments.log echo "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log
deleted_lines: do echo -n "heat deployment-show out put for deployment: $failed" >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo -e $(heat deployment-show $failed | jq -r .output_values.deploy_stderr) >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log

commit_message:
Add dlrn-gate-testing job type for roles-deploy.sh

The new job type is for third party gates that use the unpromoted
testing images. This can help developers check if their change fixes
the promotion jobs before submission.

Change-Id: Ib2ea8b77b6c4a5e0fc3154e9c81fdee5a7a3ea19

commit_message:
Add persistent volume to Glance

In order to run Glance in kubernetes multinode cluster, Glance must use
persistent volume so the glance images would be accessible from any
compute nodes. This PS adds persistent volume, persistent volume claim
and the script to instantiate glance disk.

Change-Id: Icbbcacf2e4c7186d5171c4df6159bd9733df5a2b
Partially-implementes: blueprint glance-kubernetes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/04/348304/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {%- set resourceName = kolla_kubernetes.cli.args.service_name %} {%- set size = '10Gi' %} apiVersion: v1 kind: PersistentVolumeClaim metadata: name: {{ resourceName }} {%- if storage_provider in ["aws"] %} annotations: volume.alpha.kubernetes.io/storage-class: experimental_can_be_anything_in_kubernetes_1_2 {%- endif %} spec: accessModes: - ReadWriteOnce resources: requests: storage: {{ size }}

subject: Replace functions 'Dict.get' and 'del' with 'Dict.pop'

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-04 10:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/cells.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/332a67a835fafeed2f682827fac4acab804bd57b', 'message': "Replace functions 'Dict.get' and 'del' with 'Dict.pop'

Refactoring code: Making 'cell' dict to use single instruction: pop()
rather than two instructions: get() and del, giving the codes a format
that carries through.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I56f2e1c5e6c790c0db2a6ddf6432c258774d1a56
"}]
commit_message:
Replace functions 'Dict.get' and 'del' with 'Dict.pop'

Refactoring code: Making 'cell' dict to use single instruction: pop()
rather than two instructions: get() and del, giving the codes a format
that carries through.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I56f2e1c5e6c790c0db2a6ddf6432c258774d1a56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/351099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cell['is_parent'] = cell.pop('type') == 'parent'

subject: Remove hostnetworking for Nova control plane and convert to RC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 22:35:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/fce2d46bd28b7cd9cd9cb284215cf35b0ef19a0e', 'message': 'Remove hostnetworking for Nova control plane and convert to RC

 * Broke out the discrete Nova containers into individual
   replication controllers instead of having them running all
   within the same pod.  You want to be able to scale them
   discretely down the road.
 * Convert the discrete pods to replication controllers
 * Split out the service (The Nova API ought to be exposed to
   users, but the Metadata API shouldn't)
 * Turned off Host networking.

Current config file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"
rabbitmq_servers: "rabbitmq"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
neutron_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_database_address: "mariadb"

commit_message:
Remove hostnetworking for Nova control plane and convert to RC

 * Broke out the discrete Nova containers into individual
   replication controllers instead of having them running all
   within the same pod.  You want to be able to scale them
   discretely down the road.
 * Convert the discrete pods to replication controllers
 * Split out the service (The Nova API ought to be exposed to
   users, but the Metadata API shouldn't)
 * Turned off Host networking.

Current config file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"
rabbitmq_servers: "rabbitmq"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
neutron_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_database_address: "mariadb"
nova_api_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"
neutron_host: "neutron"
glance_database_address: "mariadb"
enable_rabbitmq_cluster: "no"

storage_provider: "host"

Change-Id: I18e09843b5bebc0c71f7e98df59f7179831fe55d
Partially-implements: blueprint remove-net-host
Partially-implements: blueprint replication-controllers
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services

commit_message:
Officially deprecate agent passthru classes and API

We've introduced the new set of API endpoints for lookup and heartbeat
which all drivers should implement now and all ramdisk should use.

IPA switched to the new API in the Newton release. The deprecated passthru
endpoints and classes will be removed in the Ocata release.

Change-Id: If0d189ecdd4b84d1dbac274e6dec200e13dfe37c
Depends-On: I7160c99ca63585fc333482fa578fdf5e0962b2b6
Closes-Bug: #1570841

commit_message:
Disable "wait_for_external_config" while applying 9.x

Right now 9.x deployment contains 50min timeout created for astute.yaml
modifications but it useless and consumes time when we want to apply
9.x over 9.0 via bootsrtap_admin_node.sh
Updater script https://review.openstack.org/346119 without this timeout
is under development. We can save about 1h of deployment with this
temporary solution before the updater script will be released.

Change-Id: Icd2b9906c3c3195970f858a4164920b959616352
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/41/351041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # this is temporary solution for disabling 50min timeout; # should be removed when the main script for 9.0->9.x will be merged self.ssh_manager.execute_on_remote( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, cmd='sed -i ' '"s/wait_for_external_config=yes/wait_for_external_config=no/"' ' /etc/fuel/bootstrap_admin_node.conf') # end of temporary solution

commit_message:
Use constraints for releasenotes

OpenStack CI has now enabled constraints for releasenotes, use them -
remove the special install command.

Note that venv still cannot use constraints, this needs more changes
in OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: I125cb906f89c1de4227dc53521e1a60241ace997
Depends-On: If5d6b11bd795091eef949001cca6e8d4ec723ef2

commit_message:
enable dns resolution from guests in neutron

When running a default devstack environment, having guests that
actually can resolve DNS, so that they can do package updates from
well known hosts. This addresses a gap between nova-net and neutron
behavior in devstack.

Change-Id: I42fdc2716affd933e9158f1ef7ecb20bc664ef21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/28/351328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # make it so we have working DNS from guests iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dnsmasq_local_resolv True

commit_message:
Add a way to enable file injection for nova/tempest

File injection is disabled by default for the libvirt
driver in nova. This adds a variable to enable file
injection for the libvirt driver and is also used
to configure tempest.conf for running personality
tests.

Change-Id: I34790fadeffd6e3fdc65bd9feed3d6e62316896c
Related-Bug: #1598581
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/53/336953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute-feature-enabled personality ${ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION:-False}

added_lines:
# sunanchen , 2016. #zanata"Project-Id-Version: horizon 10.0.0.0b3.dev184 ""POT-Creation-Date: 2016-08-08 23:05+0000 ""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-08-09 08:28+0000 " "Last-Translator: sunanchen """Manage" an existing volume from a Cinder host. This will make the volume " "visible within OpenStack.

This is equivalent to the cinder " "manage command." msgstr "" "CinderOpenStack

commit_message:
Define volume services_client as library

Volume services_clients have good interfaces now,
then this patch makes them as a library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I1b4f38033830ce7bed24d97e73072fd7a2f03f09

commit_message:
Add unit tests for nova_helper.py

The nova helper does not have a sufficient code coverage.
This commit raises its coverage from 39% to 89%.
And unit tests find two bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1607198
Change-Id: Iebb693cd09e512ce44702eddca8ead0c7310b263
Closes-Bug: #1599849

commit_message:
Rename (pre/post)condition to (pre/post)_condition

This patch updates the applier's abstract methods to be consistent
with other abstract methods of similar nature.

Also included are a few other miscellaneous changes.

Change-Id: Ia1527c00332011412aba2ab326ec986f1e773001
Closes-bug: 1606634

commit_message:
Rework upgrade with plugin test

Since we are not testing detach-db plugin its time to switch to example plugin
- Move plugin test to separate file
- Replace detach-db plugin with example_v3 plugin
- Download the plugin by URL passed via EXAMPLE_V3_PLUGIN_REMOTE_URL env var

Change-Id: I99217686be856acd8e69e93e5dd3ae40cbb1f15b
Closes-bug:1603415
